q: What are the main symptoms of a chest infection?
a: The main symptoms of a chest infection include a chesty cough, wheezing and shortness of breath, chest pain or discomfort, high temperature, headache, aching muscles, and tiredness.

q: How long do symptoms of a chest infection usually last?
a: Symptoms of a chest infection usually get better on their own in about 7 to 10 days, but the cough and mucus can last up to 3 weeks.

q: What can I do to treat a chest infection myself?
a: You can rest, drink plenty of water, raise your head while sleeping, use painkillers to reduce temperature and muscle pain, and drink a hot lemon and honey drink to relieve a sore throat.

q: How can I make a hot lemon and honey drink?
a: Squeeze half a lemon into a mug of boiled water, add 1 to 2 teaspoons of honey, and drink it while still warm. Note: Do not give hot drinks to small children and do not give honey to children under 12 months old.

q: What can a pharmacist recommend for treating a chest infection?
a: A pharmacist can recommend cough medicines to help loosen the mucus in your lungs. However, cough medicines are not suitable for children under 6 years old.
